results.title: Tony Hunt: Kwakiutl artist
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and North American Indian Films
results.brief_description: Tony Hunt, a Kwakiutl Indian, is the grandson of the legendary Chief Mungo Martin. Since his initial tutoring by his grandfather, Tony has become an artist of international recognition capable of working in many art forms. In this film he makes a beautiful silver spoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and North American Indian Films

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.title: Tonga royal
results.brief_description: A cinematographic tour of the Pacific island kingdom of Tonga. Shows the natural beauty, the people, and the ceremonies of the island.

results.title: Tomorrow: the thinking machine
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Webster, Rene Bras, Thomas Wolf and CBS Television
results.brief_description: A report on the only two known objects in the universe that seem capable of reasoning - the human brain and the electronic computer. Leading scientists display a computer that seems to learn as a child learns, writes a television play and plays draughts - and wins.

results.title: Tomorrow is today
results.brief_description: Tells of the expanding needs of an increasing population; discusses the stresses and strains of youth and the responsibility of leadership as education, science and industry move ahead. Describes the advantages that scouting offers to a community.
